text: The portals of darkness are open, and theshadows of the dead hunt over the Earth...
title: Faust

text: "Back! Hold! Why dost thou scourgemankind with War, Plague, Famine?!"
title: Faust

text: "Never will the Earth be thine:Man belongs to God!"
title: Faust

text: "All things in heaven and on Earth
title: Faust

text: "A knave like all others!He preaches good and does evil!
title: Faust

text: He seeks to turnbase metal into gold!
title: Faust

text: "A wager: I will wrestFaust's soul away from God!"
title: Faust

text: "If thou canst destroy what is divine
title: Faust

text: in Faust, the Earth is thine!"
title: Faust

text: "No man can resist evil!The bet is on!"
title: Faust

text: in a few days half the town lay dying.
title: Faust

text: To find a cure for the Plague,
title: Faust

text: And there was a great cry in Egypt, forthere was not a house without its dead.
title: Faust

text: "Lord God, bless this act of redemption!
title: Faust

text: Only you can alleviate our misery!"
title: Faust

text: Mortal terror and fear of deathswept through the town.
title: Faust

text: "Repent, fast, pray!Only Faith can vanquish death!"
title: Faust

text: "We still live, we still love! We shalldie dancing in each other's arms!"
title: Faust

text: "Who has faith shall live!But death will take the sinners!"
title: Faust

text: "Get hence! We are lost!No faith is any help.
title: Faust

text: No knowledge is any help.All is vanity... "
title: Faust

text: Mine God, thou art mercifuland a great goodness.
title: Faust

text: The third great Keyto the Force of the Ghost of Hell.
title: Faust

text: And if thou would summon the Prince ofDarkness to aid thee and give thee
title: Faust

text: all the might and glory of the world, go toa crossroad and call on him three times.
title: Faust

text: "I invoke thy aid,Spirit of Darkness: show thyself!"
title: Faust

text: "As thou art called withthy unholy name:
title: Faust

text: I renounce God and his heavenly legion,and so shall be mine
title: Faust

text: the power and glory of the world.
title: Faust

text: "To have the power to helpfor only one day!"
title: Faust

text: "One day! Try it!Just one trial day!"
title: Faust

text: "... you go free, the Pactcanceled! Sign!"
title: Faust

text: "Can you help the hungryand the sick?"
title: Faust

text: "What you wish I will perform: you arethe master and I am your servant. "
title: Faust

text: "Then I shall helpin the devil's name!"
title: Faust

text: "In the name of Christ crucified,help my child!"
title: Faust

text: "He is in league with the devil!Stone him! Stone him!"
title: Faust

text: "You may not cheat me! Rememberour pact: the trial day is not over yet. "
title: Faust

text: "It is life, Faust, seducing you withthe fair image of your youth. "
title: Faust

text: "Wretched Faust, why do you seekdeath? You have not yet lived!"
title: Faust

text: "Your life was only the dust andmold of books! Pleasure is all!"
title: Faust

text: "I offer you the greateasthappiness: youth! Seize it!"
title: Faust

text: "... and the spinning Earthwill spread before you!"
title: Faust

text: "The wedding feast for the Duchess ofParma, the most beautiful woman in Italy!"
title: Faust

text: "To pay tribute to the highest beauty, mylord brings you his kingdom's treasures!"
title: Faust

text: "The day is over! The sand has run out!Be as you were!"
title: Faust

text: "You have tasted all of life's pleasures, Faust! From indulgenceto indulgence, sensation without end, yet nothing satisfied you!"
title: Faust

text: "What will you: a woman, a game of chance, an orgy?Whatever you wish, I must grant!"
title: Faust

text: "Is today a feast day in your town?"
title: Faust

text: "Are you heathen born that you have never heardof Holy Easter?"
title: Faust

text: "It is as if life had stood still:All is as it once was!"
title: Faust

text: "An innocent little girl, running to a priest...she is not for you!"
title: Faust

text: "I know more obliging wenches.for you here!"
title: Faust

text: "I want only her.Do as I command!"
title: Faust

text: "Once she has this little golden chain in thehouse she will begin to feel the devil's power!"
title: Faust

text: "Tell the mother of God,if you cannot tell me!"
title: Faust

text: "Three little drops from this love potion by nightand all the girls' hearts will be yours!"
title: Faust

text: "Look Aunt Marthe what I foundin my drawer... "
title: Faust

text: "I found it in my jewelry box!"
title: Faust

text: "Just once let me try onthe beautiful necklace!"
title: Faust

text: "A small bouquet for the bridegroom,a little wreath for the bride!"
title: Faust

text: "Pardon, lovely lady.I seek Frau Marthe Schwerdtlein!"
title: Faust

text: "He gave me this necklaceas a gift for you!"
title: Faust

text: "Those we encircle within this ringshall be sweethearts...!"
title: Faust

text: "Pardon: my stomach is too weakfor such a fiery drink!"
title: Faust

text: "Permit, that I mix myself a litle drinkas I learned it in Padua!"
title: Faust

text: "My friend, a prince of the noblest blood!"
title: Faust

text: "Yes, with all his heart he loves you!"
title: Faust

text: "What are you waiting for?Your sweetheart herself lights the way for you!"
title: Faust

text: "I will keep the brother out of the way!"
title: Faust

text: "No other girl is as pretty as your sister:long live Gretchen!"
title: Faust

text: "If you hurry you can catch her loverbefore he slips out of her room. "
title: Faust

text: "Flee!... Flee! The deputesalready seek the murderer!"
title: Faust

text: "Touch me not, you wanton,your lover has slain me!"
title: Faust

text: "First read a requiem. Mass for me!Then to the stocks with this harlot!"
title: Faust

text: "Now death and nature with surprise Behold the tremblingsinners rise To meet the Judge's searching eyes. "
title: Faust

text: "For now before the Judge severeNo crime can pass unpunished here. "
title: Faust

text: "And has born a little childin the depth of winter. "
title: Faust

text: "Are you not Gretchen, who stood in the stocks?"
title: Faust

text: "She has killed her child!Seize her, the murderess!"
title: Faust

text: "You have betrayed me!She suffers! She suffers!"
title: Faust

text: "To the stake with the child murderer!"
title: Faust

text: "Too late! Even now they build her funeral pyre!"
title: Faust

text: "You are still my servant!Bring me to her, or the pact is broken!"
title: Faust

text: "Oh had I never wished for youth, that brought this misery!Curse... curse the delusion of youth!"
title: Faust

text: "You have yourself cursed youth!What you wish I must grant!"
title: Faust

text: "Be as you were: an old man!"
title: Faust

text: "The Word that wings joyfully throughout the universe, The Word that appeases every pain andgrief, The Word that expiates all human guilt, the Eternal Word... dost thou not know it?"
title: Faust
